radiographic_examinations.findings: shortened long bones with fixed flexion bilaterally at the elbow, wrist, and knee joints, as well as bilateral talipes
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: serious shortening of the long bones, eventually lagging 10 weeks behind dates at 33 weeks; by mid-gestation, bilateral fractures of the femur and humerus were diagnosed, and kyphosis of the lower lumbar spine was documented

radiographic_examinations.findings: significant cardiomegaly with an enlarged right heart secondary to severe tricuspid valve regurgitation, pulmonary valve insufficiency, and a small arterial duct; left heart structures were normal with preserved biventricular systolic function and a normal atrial rhythm
